title: Concentration at equilibrium with large K - X + 2Q

content.prompt:
X(g) + 2 Q(g) ⇄ R(g) + Z(g)   Kc = 1.3 × 105 at 50°C

A 1.0 mol sample of X(g) and a 1.0 mol sample of Q(g) are introduced into an evacuated, rigid 10.0 L container and allowed to reach equilibrium at 50°C according to the equation above. At equilibrium, which of the following is true about the concentrations of the gases?

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
